#include<stdio.h>

unsigned long long fib[51];

int main()
{


   unsigned long long i,t,a,b,r;

   fib[0]=1;

   fib[1]=1;

   for(i=2;i<51;i++)
   {

     fib[i]=fib[i-1]+fib[i-2];

   }

   /* the above is the use of dynamic programming to store fibonacci numbers at each step in an array.

      And, then use it for obtaining the next number of the series .

   */

   scanf("%llu",&t);

   while(t--)
   {

      scanf("%llu%llu%llu",&a,&b,&r);

      r--;

      if( r == 0 )

      printf("%llu\n",a);

      else if( r == 1 )

           printf("%llu\n",b);

           else printf("%llu\n",fib[r-1]*b +fib[r-2]*a) ;

   }

   return  0;

}
